reviewText:
Early Access Review

25.01
The game has potential to become fun and safe way to let off your steam, but in its current state I wouldn't recomend it.
Pros:
intuitive, fast-paced, has potential
Cons:
Unity (you might need a new PC when the game hits release stage), microtransactions (disturbing this early), controls are awful
Might be a good idea to wait and see what will the game will grow into.

upd 17.02
Somehow the game became even worse.
Searching for any game took a couple of minutes before I gave up. Then I tried to join conquest (that was pretty fast) and the tip kindly informed me that drinks are refilled after respawn (P2W yeah). Ok, I thought, let's see what's the game like now. Well, awful is not enough to describe it. Graph has improved from what I remember, but every other aspect is unchanged or even worse.
There were only 2 other players on the map. You could rolldodge like some freaking sonic before and now you have to mash the button to make the idiot do that. There's STILL no way to lock on the enemy. The controls became less responsive than before. As it's still EA I have a little hope it will improve, but only little.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hooligan Fighters is 3rd person multiplayer brawl figthing game.

Very plesant surprise for begining of the 2016, even in early access game runs great!
For now there are 2 type of playable mods Skirmish and Conquest, I would strongly suggest adding a capture the flag. There is no bigger shame for oposite team fans than to lose a flag :)
I would also like to suggest blood & gore, and that you can actualy customize clothes (amblems,colors...)
Rest of things im interested in are already stated in game description that will come with future updates.

There are two type of currency in-game Respect Points(RP) and Gold, RP are earned by simply playing game, while gold is only buyable with real money?! But wait a minute, this isnt Pay2Win game, you can also with RP buy same stuff as with gold, only you would need a bit more grinding. I also heard that ¨maybe¨ there should be exchange option added, to switch RP to Gold, like in Wargaming games, we will yet see if it will happen with times to come.
The best thing there is that if someone do play with premium acc, with energy drinks, that may give him stronger hit, HP rege, and you just started playing game, you can still kick his a**. overskill him, or just throw brick to his head xD

Graphic for current state is very decent and satisfactory.
Sound OK for now, but I would love to see emotes, yell,rage...etc


Overall;
If you are in fighting games, this is a MUST BUY! Hooligan Fighters offer so much for acceptable money.

Graphic:         8/10
Sound  :      7,5/10
Gameplay:  8,5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hooligan Fighters is MMO fighting game what based at close combat fight.
This game game just some days ago come to steam and now in Early Access. At the moment game have two game modes. For playing you should crate own character. After this you can start a fight. In a fights you can use punches and kicks also you can grab a thing from the land for example stone. After all battle you got XP and cash to. When you level up you can you unlock new fighting skills and clothes to buy. For buy this you can use the money what you earned in battles or premium. Also you can buy boosters or ability changer cards. The controls are enough simple,  you can learn it fast. Sounds are okey, graphic in some moments looks good, but a character not very detailed. The game at the moment have some bugs and the fight are also not looks to smooth even though you turn a graphic to minimal.

So my verdict

+some fresh air in this genre
+many combo possibility in fight
+can play up to 10 vs 10

-a characters not to detailed
-some bugs
-the fight not to smooth

So, im mentioned at the start, the game now in early access because this at the moment can be some problems in game, but the developers work with it, so i hope especially the fights been fixed in closest time. This game have a good potential, so i think when its get full release its come to really enjoyable game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nControls are not bad like some reviews claim. I bring this up since ill skip over a game when i see that sometimes in the negetives. They are common and simple in my opinion. Left click, Right click, WASD to move, shift to sprint, E to pick up and throw and Q to use special thats pretty much it for the important ones. Just remember steam money back guarantee no questions asked within 14 days if i remeber correctly.
